summary: The Sporting Goods Excise Tax Modernization Act (S. 1649) modifies the Internal Revenue Code to treat certain marketplace providers as importers for the excise tax on sporting goods. It defines 'marketplace provider' and 'specified marketplace sale,' mandating that providers facilitating sales of imported sporting goods pay the excise tax. The bill aims to clarify tax responsibilities and its effective date is 60 days after enactment. Clarifications on related persons, exemptions, and regulations are also included.
